info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN CLEVELAND AND NORTHERN CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EDT... At 454 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Gaffney, or near Cowpens National Battlefield, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Shelby, Gaffney, Blacksburg, Patterson Springs, Earl, Cowpens National Battlefield, Boiling Springs NC, Chesnee, Cherokee Falls, and Draytonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
